title: Riot just remember that if you ever need to nerf ZZ'rot again
body:
You can make each of the minions it spawns give 8 gold and people will think twice about buying it and using it.

Being honest here, {{item:3512}} and to a much lesser extent {{item:3060}} are some of the only items that feel "fun" for me as a support.  I think you should be planning to add more strategic map control items for supports (and supportive tanks in top/jungle) instead of considering nerfing Zz'rot.  I am sure you are already fully aware that supporting is already the least popular role in general.  Zz'rot makes supporting feel impactful and strategically interesting.  

It's not even a really common item.  Even the champs that frequently get Zz'rot, like Shen and Nautilus, are still statistically much more likely to get other tank items like Sunfire or Spirit Visage in a game.  Now, I know some people hate anything that doesn't rely on twitch reflexes, so they'd love to whine until strategy is penalized as much as possible.  But, if you ignore those narrow-minded and selfish complaints, you will realize that destroying a strategically interesting item with only 2.5% overall popularity (according to lolking) would clearly be jumping the gun.  

I think you can better justify nerfing almost any other item in the game.  Zz'rot is clearly a somewhat rare, strategic, niche item that is fairly well balanced and that makes the least popular role (supporting) far more interesting, enjoyable, and impactful.  The only possible reasons for justifications are: 1) supports should be/feel useless; 2) strategy = cheating/unfair; 3) strategy in LCS is boring/confusing for stupid viewers.  None of those reasons hold any water whatsoever.  

Also, the gold generation concern isn't an issue - when is the last time you heard someone say that supports have too much income?  Even the non-support use cases are mostly low-kill-potential tanks who aren't going to get as much income as damage carries regardless since they can't pick up kills nearly as easily and usually don't even farm as well.  The only possible abuse case I see is Udyr, and he builds it rarely.

Or you could address the problems that were causing Zz to be so popular in the first place?

*cough*Minions*cough*

It's not that common.  Most other remotely popular tank items, {{item:3068}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3748}}, etc.  are statistically much more popular.  Zz'rot is quite rarely built in the grand scheme of things.  It's the only successful strategic diversity item Riot released - {{item:3056}} and {{item:3060}} are exceedingly rare.

Rushing ZZrot is typically not all that great. ZZrot is worthless when it comes to top lane dueling. As for supports? It offers no utility outside of lane pushing which is unnecessary early game and even mid game. Not to mention, as a support, you want to create a scenario where your adc can cs flawlessly, and rot is not conducive to that.

If you rush zzrot and I rush something like black cleaver, you're just going to get pulverized. Not to mention, since the minion damage scales off your max HP, the minions also have a hard time last hitting the wave.

I fought against a zzrot rush and what I did was simply kill the little purple things in one hit (they were awfully squishy) and then pushed the wave all the way to the enemy turret since I could (black cleaver has way better dueling potential than zzrot ever could).

If the other guy ever tried to leave lane "cuz he could with the rot keeping pressure" I would just outpush the living hell out of his rot, and while the turret is sniping my minions, just snipe the rot.

Rot rush is bad. Sirhcez did it for a while on top lane, but even he realized just how bad it was and is now trying out things like cull starter and the good ol corruption potion starter.

I mean, I don't blindly rush it unless I'm playing someone like Illaio who has very strong counterengage against someone who has weak waveclear, but I understand what you're saying. TBH, my post was poking fun at myself for being worse at last-hitting than ZZ'Rot minions. 

I will disagree on the Support point though because the income it gives you in combination with Banner of Command is crazy. Of course, it's a gamble when you buy it and I don't do it every game, but I easily net 1000 gold over several minutes when I do. I also should have clarified that I don't rush ZZ'Rot on supports, though, because, as you said, it does my ADC 100% no good.
